page.title: 20HISTORY OF CRUWYS MORCHARD
page.content: Cruwys Morchard means the cross or cross-way in the great wood or 'mor ket' which stretched between Exmoor and Dartmoor. The manor was held by Almar before 1066, since 1175 by the Cruwys family. The other Domesday manor in the area is Ruckham. Many of the farms are of medieval origin but local research shows that farm boundaries have changed through time. Farms have always been worked as units, not held in common. The hamlet of Pennymoor was first mentioned in the 17c. The earliest stonework in the Church of the Holy Cross is 14c, but rectors are recorded from 1261. The main walls are 16c Decorated Gothic but the interior and part of the tower were renewed after lightning hit the spire in 1689. Many farms have named pews in the church. CRUWYS MORCHARD WOMEN'S INSTITUTE.
